column4: Has anyone here use Linux compilers that will compile Microsoft source code?
Is this mingw32 a POSIX compliant compiler?
as far as i know posix does not cover any C compiler

yes i know what posix is, but again posix spec does not cover the compiler only the Operating system API and some tools. Linux is posix compliant bash can be. but there is no spec for a posix compliant C compiler
i dunno; what are you trying to do ? that would help me guess ehat you want to know
writte posix compliant C programs in linux that will run unmodified in windows ??? then you can do that with mingw
the most used compiler in Linux is gcc
if you want to program in linux in C you use gcc
why not use a precompiled ircd Â¿?
we do not support red hat here
only the oposite is true. a 32 bit ubuntu should work on a x86_64 cpu becouse they are backwards compatible
yes there is a i386 server iso image in all mirrors
apt installs both the programs and the dependencies from the same repositories
are those included with the installation of Ubuntu from the outset?
i do not understand your question; what is included?
on the aame lan you can configure wake on lan
